title: South African Markets - Factors to watch on Oct. 4
text:
© Reuters. South African Markets - Factors to watch on Oct. 4

The following company announcements, scheduled economic indicators, debt and currency market moves and political events may affect South African markets on Friday.

ECONOMIC EVENTS

South Africa's treasury holds its weekly auction of bills and bonds

SOUTH AFRICAN MARKETS

South Africa's rand firmed on Thursday thanks to a weaker dollar, as investors fretted that weakness in the U.S. manufacturing and service sectors could herald a slowdown in the world's largest economy.

Stocks on the other hand suffered as a result of the negative sentiment. The Johannesburg Stock Exchange's All-Share Index fell 0.51% to 53,727 points, while the blue-chip Top-40 Index shed 0.54% to 47,743 points. .J ZAR/

GLOBAL MARKETS

Asian stocks edged higher on Friday, thanks to gains on Wall Street, but the mood was cautious before a key U.S. job report that could help determine whether the Federal Reserve cuts interest rates further. MKTS/GLOB

WALL STREET

Wall Street stocks climbed on Thursday after data showing U.S. services-sector activity at a three-year low fueled expectations that the Federal Reserve would cut interest rates to stem a wider economic downturn. .N

GOLD

Gold prices rose for a fourth straight session on Friday as weak U.S. economic data fanned fears over sluggish growth, with investors awaiting a key jobs report that could cement expectations for further rate cuts by the Federal Reserve. GOL/
